alert.note: Alert for Lafayette; Panola (Mississippi) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Memphis (Western Tennessee, Eastern Arkansas and Northern Mississippi)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued July 03 at 6:48PM CDT until July 05 at 2:12PM CDT by NWS Memphis
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 845 PM CDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Urban and small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of North Mississippi, including the following counties, Lafayette and Panola. * WHEN...Until 845 PM CDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Water over roadways. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 647 PM CDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. This will cause urban and small stream flooding. Between 1 and 1.5 inches of rain have fallen in the past hour. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Oxford, Batesville, Water Valley, John W Kyle State Park, Holly Springs National Forest, Sardis, Pope, Burgess, Springdale, Pleasant Grove, Curtis Station, Courtland, Abbeville, Taylor, Hayes Crossing, Shuford, Eureka Springs, College Hill, College Hill Station and Chapeltown. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads.
